meanings.definition: The quality or state of being destructive.
meanings.sent1: The destructivity of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The destructivity of the fire was evident in the charred remains of the building.
meanings.sent3: The destructivity of the mischievous puppy was evident in the torn pillows and chewed shoes.
meanings.sent4: The destructivity of the tornado was like a giant vacuum cleaner sucking up everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The destructivity of the volcano spewed molten lava, engulfing everything in its fiery embrace.

meanings.definition: The tendency to cause harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: His destructivity towards others often resulted in broken friendships.
meanings.sent2: The destructivity of the chemicals on the environment was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The destructivity of the toddler's tantrum was surprisingly loud and disruptive.
meanings.sent4: The destructivity of gossip can spread like wildfire, causing harm to reputations.
meanings.sent5: The destructivity of neglecting maintenance led to the collapse of the bridge.

meanings.definition: The capacity to destroy or ruin.
meanings.sent1: The destructivity of the bomb was devastating to the city.
meanings.sent2: The destructivity of the invasive species threatened the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The destructivity of the computer virus wiped out all the important files.
meanings.sent4: The destructivity of time slowly eroded the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The destructivity of the floodwaters washed away homes and livelihoods.
